Trial_Design.evidence: The Single Ventricle Reconstruction trial randomized patients

Intervention.evidence: randomized patients with single right ventricle lesions to a modified Blalock-Taussig or right ventricle-to-pulmonary artery shunt

Objective.evidence: This analysis describes outcomes at the stage II procedure and factors associated with a longer hospital length of stay (LOS).

Method_Outcome.evidence: We examined the association of shunt type with stage II hospital outcomes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: There were 393 subjects in the analytic cohort.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median stage II procedure hospital LOS (8 days, IQR (6,14)), hospital mortality (4.3%), transplantation (0.8%), median ventilator time (2 days, IQR (1,3)), median intensive care unit LOS (4 days (IQR (3,7))

Harms.evidence: serious adverse events did not differ by shunt type
